SENT.plain: A new head position for use during operation on young children with cranial deformities is described
The position allows exposure of the entire calvarium from the supraorbital ridges to the posterior rim of the foramen magnum
It is a modification of the conventional prone position involving hyperextension of the neck
The authors have safely used this position to perform one-stage radical cranial remodeling procedures that previously required two stages
The advantages of this position and the methods for achieving it are discussed
